  (function () {
    var noop = function noop() {};
    if ("performance" in window === false) {
      window.performance = {};
    }
    window.performance.mark = performance.mark || noop;
    window.performance.measure = performance.measure || noop;
    if ("now" in window.performance === false) {
      var nowOffset = Date.now();
      if (performance.timing && performance.timing.navigationStart) {
        nowOffset = performance.timing.navigationStart;
      }
      window.performance.now = function now() {
        return Date.now() - nowOffset;
      };
    }
  })();
  </script>

Russian VPN gateways are potentially providing anonymity for Vidar operators / customers, making it more challenging for analysts to have a complete overview of this threat. These gateways now appear to be migrating to Tor.2. Vidar operators appear to be expanding their infrastructure, so analysts need to keep them in their sights. We expect a new wave of customers and as a result, an increase of campaigns in the upcoming we"/>

<script id="wix-first-paint">
    if (window.ResizeObserver &&
        (!window.PerformanceObserver || !PerformanceObserver.supportedEntryTypes || PerformanceObserver.supportedEntryTypes.indexOf('paint') === -1)) {
        new ResizeObserver(function (entries, observer) {
            entries.some(function (entry) {
                var contentRect = entry.contentRect;
                if (contentRect.width > 0 && contentRect.height > 0) {
                    requestAnimationFrame(function (now) {
                        window.wixFirstPaint = now;
                        dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent('wixFirstPaint'));
                    });
                    observer.disconnect();
                    return true;
                }
            });
        }).observe(document.body);
    }
</script>

</span></span></span></a></div></div></div></div></div></section></div></div></div></div></section></div></div></div></div></header><main id="PAGES_CONTAINER" class="PAGES_CONTAINER" tabindex="-1" data-testid="page-bg"></div><div class="HT5ybB"><div id="Containery3r05" class="Containery3r05 SPY_vo"><div data-mesh-id="Containery3r05inlineContent" data-testid="inline-content" class=""><div data-mesh-id="Containery3r05inlineContent-gridContainer" data-testid="mesh-container-content"><section id="comp-loyoqkbd" tabindex="-1" class="Oqnisf comp-loyoqkbd wixui-section" data-block-level-container="ClassicSection"><div id="bgLayers_comp-loyoqkbd" data-hook="bgLayers" data-motion-part="BG_LAYER" class="MW5IWV"><div data-testid="colorUnderlay" class="LWbAav Kv1aVt"></div><div id="bgMedia_comp-loyoqkbd" data-motion-part="BG_MEDIA" class="VgO9Yg"></div></div><div data-mesh-id="comp-loyoqkbdinlineContent" data-testid="inline-content" class=""><div data-mesh-id="comp-loyoqkbdinlineContent-gridContainer" data-testid="mesh-container-content"><!--$--><div id="TPAMultiSection_l3smphcw" class="TWFxr5 "><div class="TPAMultiSection_l3smphcw"><div><div style="--root-width:980px" class="md lt-lg lt-xl gt-xs gt-s gt-sm gt-740 gt-830 gt-886 gt-940 w686-980 lte-w980 lte-banner-w1564 lte-banner-w1425 lte-banner-w1181 lte-banner-w980 class="gXfmMa" data-hook="search-input"></div></div></div></div><div class="mbKyhH fsZ7OF mFmpGg blog-post-page-font" data-hook="post-page"><div class=""><div id="TPAMultiSection_l3smphcw.above-content-1" data-hook="slot-placeholder-TPAMultiSection_l3smphcw.above-content-1" class=""></div></div><div class=""><div id="TPAMultiSection_l3smphcw.above-content-2" data-hook="slot-placeholder-TPAMultiSection_l3smphcw.above-content-2" class=""></div></div><div class="zp8IQu"><div><div><div class="EcwjNF"><article class="j3D9DG blog-post-page-font blog-card-background-color blog-card-border-color blog-text-color" style="border-width:1px" data-hook="post"><div class="BL3dva"><div class="OSxNQL"><div class="OFA52E"><div class="IeNfNP"><div class="xUuoH9 v0bFi9"><span class="F4tRtJ"><a data-hook="profile-link" class=""><span class="lBv2XN blog-text-color blog-link-hover-color avatar blog-post-text-color"><span title="S2 Research Team" class="tQ0Q1A user-name dlINDG" data-hook="user-name">S2 Research Team</span></span></a></span><span class="F4tRtJ"><span class="Ki_0_s rmqd9q blog-separator-background-color"></span></span><span class="F4tRtJ"><div class="xUuoH9 MBUSKJ"><span class="UZa2Xr"><span title="Jan 19, 2023" class="post-metadata__date time-ago" data-hook="time-ago">Jan 19, 2023</span></span><span class="UZa2Xr"><span class="Ki_0_s rmqd9q blog-separator-background-color"></span></span><span class="UZa2Xr"><span class="post-metadata__readTime" title="8 min read" data-hook="time-to-read">8 min read</span></span></div></span></div><div class="UPa2xo JDQ812"><button class="u5Zxn8 jG7PL8 _EA3Ke more-button" type="button" aria-pressed="false" aria-label="More actions" id="more-button-ad2b5b67-c1a1-4272-a8a6-e41ba8794783" data-hook="more-button"><span class="Bvf4SR"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="19" viewBox="0 0 19 19" 3.99985313,8.67880182 4,9.50012255 C3.98424812,10.3439921 3.28763905,11.0153508 2.44398805,10.9997329 L2.44398805,10.9997329 Z M2.44398805,15.9997329 C1.62345525,15.9690612 0.980075653,15.2841888 blog-post-title-color blog-text-color post-title blog-hover-container-element-color FG3qXk blog-post-page-title-font" data-hook="post-title"><span class="post-title__text blog-post-title-font blog-post-title-color"><span class="blog-post-title-font blog-post-title-color">Darth Vidar: The Dark Side of Evolving Threat Infrastructure</span></span></h1></div></div><p class="lkwdFf OFA52E">Updated: <span title="Jul 20, 2023" class="time-ago" data-hook="time-ago">Jul 20, 2023</span></p></div></div><div class="nLG8d5 F_3u4N" data-hook="post-description"><article class="blog-post-page-font"><div class="post-content__body stSKMK"><div class="moHCnT"><div class="moHCnT"><div style="--rce-text-color:rgb(0, 0, 0);--rce-opaque-background-color:rgb(255, 255, 255);--rce-divider-color:rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);--rce-active-divider-color:rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5);--rce-highlighted-color:rgb(247, 159, 0);--rce-link-hashtag-color:rgb(247, 159, 0);--rce-mobile-font-size:16px;--rce-header-two-font-size:28px;--rce-header-three-font-size:22px;--rce-header-four-font-size:20px;--rce-header-five-font-size:18px;--rce-header-six-font-size:16px;--rce-mobile-header-two-font-size:24px;--rce-mobile-header-three-font-size:20px;--rce-mobile-header-four-font-size:20px;--rce-mobile-header-five-font-size:20px;--rce-mobile-header-six-font-size:20px;--rce-mobile-quotes-font-size:20px" class="fTEXDR" data-rce-version="10.103.0"><div class="Y9hzn" dir="ltr" style="--ricos-text-color:#000000;--ricos-text-color-tuple:0, 0, 0;--ricos-action-color:#f79f00;--ricos-action-color-tuple:247, 159, 0;--ricos-background-color:#ffffff;--ricos-background-color-tuple:255, 255, 255;--ricos-fallback-color:#000000;--ricos-fallback-color-tuple:0, 0, 0;--ricos-settings-action-color:#000000;--ricos-settings-action-color-tuple:0, 0, 0;--ricos-action-color-fallback:#000000;--ricos-action-color-fallback-tuple:0, 0, 0;--ricos-custom-p-font-weight:normal;--ricos-custom-p-font-style:normal;--ricos-custom-p-line-height:1.5;--ricos-custom-p-font-size:18px;--ricos-custom-p-font-family:wfont_069f35_23de2075afcc42cc848bac4f05c000f8,wf_23de2075afcc42cc848bac4f0,orig_roboto;--ricos-custom-p-text-decoration:none;--ricos-custom-p-color:rgba(0,0,0,1);--ricos-custom-h1-font-weight:normal;--ricos-custom-h1-font-style:normal;--ricos-custom-h1-line-height:1.5;--ricos-custom-h1-font-size:40px;--ricos-custom-h1-font-family:wfont_08d9c0_ddeef9d2956f4aa0b036bb65e0bf6f02,wf_ddeef9d2956f4aa0b036bb65e,orig_changa_medium;--ricos-custom-h1-color:rgba(0,0,0,1);--ricos-custom-h2-font-weight:normal;--ricos-custom-h2-font-style:normal;--ricos-custom-h2-line-height:1.5;--ricos-custom-h2-font-size:28px;--ricos-custom-h2-font-family:wfont_08d9c0_ddeef9d2956f4aa0b036bb65e0bf6f02,wf_ddeef9d2956f4aa0b036bb65e,orig_changa_medium;--ricos-custom-h2-color:rgba(0,0,0,1);--ricos-custom-h3-font-weight:normal;--ricos-custom-h3-font-style:normal;--ricos-custom-h3-line-height:1.5;--ricos-custom-h3-font-size:22px;--ricos-custom-h3-font-family:wfont_08d9c0_ddeef9d2956f4aa0b036bb65e0bf6f02,wf_ddeef9d2956f4aa0b036bb65e,orig_changa_medium;--ricos-custom-h3-color:rgba(0,0,0,1);--ricos-custom-h4-font-weight:normal;--ricos-custom-h4-font-style:normal;--ricos-custom-h4-line-height:1.5;--ricos-custom-h4-font-size:20px;--ricos-custom-h4-font-family:wfont_08d9c0_ddeef9d2956f4aa0b036bb65e0bf6f02,wf_ddeef9d2956f4aa0b036bb65e,orig_changa_medium;--ricos-custom-h4-color:rgba(0,0,0,1);--ricos-custom-h5-font-weight:normal;--ricos-custom-h5-font-style:normal;--ricos-custom-h5-line-height:1.5;--ricos-custom-h5-font-size:18px;--ricos-custom-h5-font-family:wfont_08d9c0_ddeef9d2956f4aa0b036bb65e0bf6f02,wf_ddeef9d2956f4aa0b036bb65e,orig_changa_medium;--ricos-custom-h5-color:rgba(0,0,0,1);--ricos-custom-h6-font-weight:normal;--ricos-custom-h6-font-style:normal;--ricos-custom-h6-line-height:1.5;--ricos-custom-h6-font-size:16px;--ricos-custom-h6-font-family:wfont_08d9c0_ddeef9d2956f4aa0b036bb65e0bf6f02,wf_ddeef9d2956f4aa0b036bb65e,orig_changa_medium;--ricos-custom-h6-color:rgba(0,0,0,1);--ricos-custom-quote-line-height:1.5;--ricos-custom-quote-font-size:24px;--ricos-custom-quote-font-family:wfont_069f35_23de2075afcc42cc848bac4f05c000f8,wf_23de2075afcc42cc848bac4f0,orig_roboto;--ricos-custom-quote-color:rgba(0,0,0,1);--ricos-custom-quote-border-color:rgb(247, 159, 0);--ricos-custom-quote-margin-inline-start:var(--ricosQuoteMarginInlineStart);--ricos-custom-code-block-line-height:1.5;--ricos-custom-link-text-decoration:inherit;--ricos-custom-link-color:rgba(247,159,0,1);--ricos-custom-link-font-style:inherit;--ricos-custom-link-font-weight:inherit;--ricos-custom-hashtag-text-decoration:inherit;--ricos-custom-hashtag-color:rgba(247,159,0,1);--ricos-custom-hashtag-font-style:inherit;--ricos-custom-hashtag-font-weight:inherit;--ricos-custom-footer-toolbar-padding-inline-start:var(--ricosFooterPadding);--ricos-custom-footer-toolbar-padding-inline-end:var(--ricosFooterPadding);--ricos-custom-editor-add-plugin-button-position-inline-start:var(--ricosAddPluginButtonStart);--ricos-breakout-normal-padding-start:var(--ricosNormalPadding);--ricos-breakout-normal-padding-end:var(--ricosNormalPadding);--ricos-breakout-full-width-padding-start:var(--ricosFullWidthPadding);--ricos-breakout-full-width-padding-end:var(--ricosFullWidthPadding)" data-id="content-viewer"><div class="qlhuS"><div type="first" data-hook="rcv-block-first"></div><div class="B84Eo"><div data-breakout="normal"><h3 class="ZSacP XMpE9 WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-foo"><span class="uZXi0"><span>Summary</span></span></h3></div><div type="heading" data-hook="rcv-block1"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-en87d"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block2"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-6cg32"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Three key takeaways from our analysis of Vidar infrastructure:</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block3"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><ol class="v6Oo2 WmV-K"><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="h4V1a" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:decimal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="" id="viewer-vfof"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Russian VPN gateways are potentially providing anonymity for Vidar operators / customers, making it more challenging for analysts to have a complete overview of this threat. These gateways now appear to be migrating to Tor.</span></span></p></li><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="h4V1a" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:decimal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="" id="viewer-qh2u"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Vidar operators appear to be expanding their infrastructure, so analysts need to keep them in their sights. We expect a new wave of customers and as a result, an increase of campaigns in the upcoming weeks.</span></span></p></li><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="h4V1a" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:decimal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="" id="viewer-23nfm"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>The analysis indicates that Vidar operators have split their infrastructure into two parts; one dedicated to their regular customers and the other for the management team, and also potentially premium / important users.</span></span></p></li></ol></div><div type="ordered_list" data-hook="rcv-block4"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-fjfqj"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block5"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><h3 class="ZSacP XMpE9 WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-83adr"><span class="uZXi0"><span>Introduction</span></span></h3></div><div type="heading" data-hook="rcv-block6"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-b6m40"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block7"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-54vke"><span class="AT4Tn"><a target="_blank" href="https://malpedia.caad.fkie.fraunhofer.de/details/win.vidar" rel="noopener" class="hEuCV uw4qb" data-hook="WebLink"><span style="color:#1155cc;text-decoration:inherit"><u style="text-decoration:underline"><span>Vidar</span></u></span></a><span> is an info-stealer malware, which was </span><a target="_blank" href="https://fumik0.com/2018/12/24/lets-dig-into-vidar-an-arkei-copycat-forked-stealer-in-depth-analysis/" rel="noopener" class="hEuCV uw4qb" data-hook="WebLink"><span style="color:#1155cc;text-decoration:inherit"><u style="text-decoration:underline"><span>first spotted</span></u></span></a><span> in the wild in late 2018 by the security researcher </span><a target="_blank" href="https://twitter.com/fumik0_" rel="noopener" class="hEuCV uw4qb" data-hook="WebLink"><span style="color:#1155cc;text-decoration:inherit"><u style="text-decoration:underline"><span>Fumik0</span></u></span></a><span>. Upon initial inspection, the identified sample appeared to be </span><a target="_blank" href="https://malpedia.caad.fkie.fraunhofer.de/details/win.arkei_stealer" rel="noopener" class="hEuCV uw4qb" data-hook="WebLink"><span style="color:#1155cc;text-decoration:inherit"><u style="text-decoration:underline"><span>Arkei</span></u></span></a><span> (another info-stealer), however differences in both the sample’s code and C2 communications were observed. The name itself (Vidar) is derived from a string found in the malware’s code. Vidar is considered to be a distinct fork of the Arkei malware family.  </span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block8"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-43a2r"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block9"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-5ra40"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Vidar has a simple business model, with “customers&#x27;&#x27; paying between $130 and $750 depending on the length of their subscription. Some personalization of the tool is possible, for example to tweak the targeted information types, although by default Vidar is designed to steal, amongst other things; browser histories, cookies, credentials, cryptocurrency wallets, and two-factor authentication software data.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block10"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-35cee"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block11"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-a7von"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>The delivery methodology for Vidar has varied over time, utilizing email / phishing lures and ‘poisoned’ cracked software targeting vendors such as AnyDesk and Windows, the latter leveraging SEO impersonation and YouTube videos to dupe users into downloading the malware.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block12"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-8j3sk"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block13"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-aruj3"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Four years after Vidar was first discovered it is now the ‘parent’ of further forks, including; Lumma, Mars, and Oski.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block14"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-704i"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block15"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-76o59"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>In this post, we’ll look into the Vidar management infrastructure, starting with the ‘main’ website and pivoting from there. This website is at the same time; the Vidar customer portal where payloads, settings, victims assets, etc. can be managed, the Vidar management portal likely used for interactions with their customers, and a staging post for the deployment of VPS servers.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block16"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-59pk8"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block17"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><h3 class="ZSacP XMpE9 WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-3i11e"><span class="uZXi0"><span>Vidar Website Overview</span></span></h3></div><div type="heading" data-hook="rcv-block18"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-6ud90"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block19"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-fsmb3"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>As observed by Fumik0 back in 2018, the ‘main’ Vidar website was hosted at </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>my-vidar[.]com</span></strong><span>, and remained at this location until 22 August 2022. On this date the site was moved to </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>my-odin[.]com</span></strong><span>, initially reusing the same SSL certificate.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block20"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-70p7j"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block21"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="tqAje" id="viewer-867m0"><div class="SErax c8QuI" style="width:min(100%, 100%)"><figure role="button" data-hook="imageViewer" tabindex="0" class="Eswhf" aria-haspopup="true"><div style="--dim-height:285;--dim-width:626" id="867m0" class="_2ynrX bqdPo z-4Pg"><wow-image id="6283c5_568023db4d5d400593bc18bb37566bec~mv2.png" class="undefined O4AJH" Vida.tar.bz2</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block52"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-e0c6n"><span dir="auto" id="viewer-3f6uk"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>This archive contains all of the aforementioned Vidar web-server requirements and also the Vidar payload. </span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block54"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-bqcmk"><span class="AT4Tn"><br id="viewer-c71pc"><span class="AT4Tn"><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>We’ll detail findings related to this archive later in this post.</span></strong></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block56"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-13tps"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block57"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><h4 class="b3gxk XMpE9 WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-d450g"><span class="uZXi0"><span>/sellers/auth/login</span></span></h4></div><div type="heading" data-hook="rcv-block58"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-64kar"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block59"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-1l92p"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>This path appears to be of particular significance to the operation, as the connection form not only requires user credentials but also a Google Authenticator token. We assess with medium confidence that this portal is used by the operators for maintenance purposes.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block60"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-b1jlj"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block61"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><h3 class="ZSacP XMpE9 WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-qskp"><span class="uZXi0"><span>Network Telemetry</span></span></h3></div><div type="heading" data-hook="rcv-block62"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-fhtkc"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block63"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-bi93e"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>By examining network telemetry for the IP address used to host the </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>my-odin[.]com</span></strong><span> domain (</span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>186.2.166.15</span></strong><span>), we were able to determine the peer IP responsible for its management. We have chosen to redact this IP due to the ongoing nature of this investigation.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block64"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-cj9c3"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block65"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-emh2r"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>This management IP is subsequently used for other activities which we have deemed of relevance to the Vidar operation.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block66"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="font-style:italic"><span style="font-size:12px"><span>Figure 5: Overview of Network Telemetry</span></span></em></strong></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block69"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-8pa5q"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block70"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><ul class="eON6s WmV-K"><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="h4V1a" class="AT4Tn"><span>Telegram</span></span></p></li></ul></div><div type="bulleted_list" data-hook="rcv-block71"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-cn611"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block72"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-e2i8v"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>We assess that the connections to Telegram infrastructure are indicative of communications between the Vidar operators and their customers, as well as other elements of the underground economy.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block73"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-275lc"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block74"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><ul class="eON6s WmV-K"><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="h4V1a" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:disc"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="" id="viewer-a18mq"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Mega</span></span></p></li></ul></div><div type="bulleted_list" data-hook="rcv-block75"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-f26nq"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block76"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-6mr72"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Connections were observed to Mega user storage infrastructure (*.userstorage.mega.co.nz), these repositories are hosted on shared infrastructure so it was not possible to discern specific user identification associated with Vidar.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block77"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-fuc22"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block78"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><ul class="eON6s WmV-K"><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="h4V1a" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:disc"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="" id="viewer-dnjrk"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Bofbot</span></span></p></li></ul></div><div type="bulleted_list" data-hook="rcv-block79"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-5va84"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block80"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-2un9v"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Bofbot appears to be a cryptocurrency / investment platform of questionable legitimacy. It is possible the Vidar operators utilize Bofbot for the processing of payments from their customers, or even a service they are involved in running themselves - the IP hosting the Bofbot domain was previously used to host the original </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>my-vidar[.]com</span></strong><span> domain.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block81"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-b8fnt"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block82"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-2dmtj"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>The IP addresses hosting </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>bofbot[.]com</span></strong><span> and</span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span> my-odin[.]com</span></strong><span> are both assigned to ‘ProManaged LLC’, an entity which provides dedicated hosting, DDoS-protection, etc. ProManaged LLC was previously associated with malicious hosting provision.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block83"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-6njkh"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block84"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-5balq"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Aside from the activity surrounding the management IP, we have observed some interesting connections to the my-odin[.]com website via six VPN gateways, with activity commencing in November 2022. All six gateways are linked to ‘Hola[.]org’.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block85"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="font-style:italic"><span style="font-size:12px"><span>Figure 6: Hola VPN Connections</span></span></em></strong></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block88"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-7p8f2"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block89"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-52bma"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>The static nature of these connections may be indicative of a particular operator / customer accessing the site via Hola VPN, or potentially a more widely shared methodology aimed at providing anonymity to the Vidar users. However, as the true source of the connections cannot be determined, these remain hypotheses at this time.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block90"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-4plgg"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block91"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-8nquv"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>In recent weeks we have also observed some of the VPN connections being replaced by traffic from the Tor network.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block92"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-e3un6"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block93"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><h3 class="ZSacP XMpE9 WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-85oi5"><span class="uZXi0"><span>What’s Inside the Archive?</span></span></h3></div><div type="heading" data-hook="rcv-block94"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-flesl"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block95"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-r99c"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>As previously mentioned, the archive utilized by Vidar customers to initiate their campaigns is named ‘Vida.tar.bz2’. This archive contains all the server files needed to run the necessary configuration.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block96"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-iq3l"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block97"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><h4 class="b3gxk XMpE9 WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-4ednu"><span class="uZXi0"><span>proxy.conf</span></span></h4></div><div type="heading" data-hook="rcv-block98"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-1lsbg"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block99"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-ccj25"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>An interesting finding is in the “proxy.conf” file, containing the settings corresponding to the campaign’s proxy setup; with a remote server IP provided as the </span><em style="font-style:italic"><span>proxy_pass</span></em><span> value.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block100"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y type="image" data-hook="rcv-block102"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y -XYEb Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-11cr8"><span class="AT4Tn"><strong style="font-weight:700"><em style="font-style:italic"><span style="font-size:12px"><span>Figure 7: proxy.conf</span></span></em></strong></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block103"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-d353h"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block104"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-bmvnv"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>As can be observed in Figure 7, the current </span><em style="font-style:italic"><span>proxy_pass</span></em><span> IP is </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>94.231.205.192</span></strong><span>, and this value appears to be updated frequently; at least for every new version release of Vidar.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block105"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-cnul1"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block106"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-1qsea"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Prior to the latest Vidar release at the beginning of January 2023, the </span><em style="font-style:italic"><span>proxy_pass</span></em><span> IP was </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>194.99.22.147</span></strong><span>; both recent </span><em style="font-style:italic"><span>proxy_pass</span></em><span> IPs are assigned to ‘MVPS LTD’. It appears that the Vidar operators have a preference for this particular provider, as the previous </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>my-vidar[.]com</span></strong><span> domain was also hosted on one of their IPs (</span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>185.243.215.136</span></strong><span>).</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block107"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-6berp"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block108"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-8rli5"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Based on PDNS data, the most recent domain hosted on </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>185.243.215.136</span></strong><span> is </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>old.my-vidar[.]net</span></strong><span>, which remains resolvable and hosts the same files as </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>my-odin[.]com</span></strong><span>; although the files point to the new site. It appears this domain (</span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>old.my-vidar[.]net</span></strong><span>) has been retained as part of the migration process.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block109"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-qsl"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block110"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-8utsa"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Examining network telemetry data for the current </span><em style="font-style:italic"><span>proxy_pass</span></em><span> IP (</span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>94.231.205.192</span></strong><span>) we are able to define the behavior of the infrastructure sitting behind it.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block111"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-da43m"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block112"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="tqAje" id="viewer-5dpk8"><div class="SErax c8QuI" type="image" data-hook="rcv-block113"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y -XYEb Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-7qvnr"><span class="AT4Tn"><strong style="font-weight:700"><em style="font-style:italic"><span style="font-size:12px"><span>Figure 8: Proxy Pass Network Telemetry</span></span></em></strong></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block114"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-8tn6f"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block115"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-9s12l"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>We can see that the </span><em style="font-style:italic"><span>proxy_pass</span></em><span> IP is used to route traffic to TCP/80 on </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>185.173.93.98</span></strong><span> (ADMAN-AS, RU), an IP which also receives inbound connections from two further IPs assigned to ‘ProManaged LLC’.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block116"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-jq94"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block117"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-6d0qn"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>From </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>185.173.93.98</span></strong><span> we also observe a point-to-point connection with </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>5.252.179.201</span></strong><span> (MivoCloud SRL, RU), using the GRE protocol. In turn, we observe </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>5.252.179.201</span></strong><span> in communication with several Vidar C2s on remote port TCP/80, as well as receiving inbound communications from the initial Vidar management IP (Figure 5), and a number of IPs identified as Tor nodes / relays.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block118"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-182ja"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block119"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-ehd4v"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Historic PDNS data for </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>5.252.179.201</span></strong><span> shows it hosting </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>new.my-vidar[.]net </span></strong><span>and </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>new.my-odin[.]com</span></strong><span> until 24 December 2022. The observed SSL certificate hosted on </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>5.252.179.201</span></strong><span> was also, for a short period of time, hosted on a second IP address.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block120"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-80o4o"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>We assess that this server may be used in the future by the Vidar operators, but for now traffic remains minimal.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block127"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-bat7r"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block128"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><h4 class="b3gxk XMpE9 WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-362hg"><span class="uZXi0"><span>proxy.conf Continued</span></span></h4></div><div type="heading" data-hook="rcv-block129"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-5plbb"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block130"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-cr92q"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Aside from the </span><em style="font-style:italic"><span>proxy_pass</span></em><span> IP address, another interesting detail in this file provides intel for the retrieval of malware configuration information, as well as also for potential hunting opportunities.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block131"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-9vojo"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block132"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-ai0mf"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Usually when requesting a Vidar C2 a 403 error is returned; as an unauthorized request for a resource. However, from the proxy.conf file (Figure 7) we can see that access will be granted when using an empty User-Agent; based on the line “</span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>if ($http_user_agent != &quot;&quot;) { return 403; }</span></strong><span>”.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block133"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-2pf7f"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block134"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="tqAje" id="viewer-8og54"><div class="SErax c8QuI" style="width:min(100%, 100%)"><figure role="button" data-hook="imageViewer" tabindex="0" class="Eswhf" type="image" data-hook="rcv-block135"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y -XYEb Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-63amp"><span class="AT4Tn"><strong style="font-weight:700"><em style="font-style:italic"><span style="font-size:12px"><span>Figure 10: Vidar Configuration Extraction Example</span></span></em></strong></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block136"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-33iml"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block137"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-26n8f"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>In the example above, we were able to extract the configuration for a recent Vidar C2 (</span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>65.109.190.87</span></strong><span>) by using this methodology. </span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block138"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-ajjdp"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block139"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-783td"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>As mentioned previously, Vidar allows for customer interaction with its configuration, so in the past few days when requesting this particular C2, we have obtained various different configurations:</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block140"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-9j7b6"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block141"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><ul class="eON6s WmV-K"><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="h4V1a" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:disc"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="" id="viewer-9ikse"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>1,1,1,1,1,41c46b16f0a37f117ca48ec104248136,1,0,1,0,0,Default;%DOCUMENTS%\;*.txt;50;true;movies:music:mp3:exe;</span><span>
</span></span><br role="presentation"/></p></li><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="h4V1a" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:disc"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="" id="viewer-3rtv1"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>1,1,1,1,1,c519931eb60ec791d08d29432098c4a8,1,1,1,1,0,Default;%DOCUMENTS%\;*.txt;900;true;movies:music:mp3:exe;Recent;%RECENT%\;*.txt;800;false;movies:music:mp3:exe;Crypto;%DESKTOP%\;*.txt;1000;false;movies:music:mp3:exe;User;%USERPROFILE%\;*.txt;1000;false;movies:music:mp3:exe;Appdata;%APPDATA%\;*.txt;1000;false;movies:music:mp3:exe</span><span>
</span></span><br role="presentation"/></p></li><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="h4V1a" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:disc"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="" id="viewer-3g4f1"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>1,1,1,1,1,d0d81123a4d0eece79fc6f8c465db7c8,1,1,1,1,0,decuments;%DOCUMENTS%\;*.txt:*.doc:*.docx:*.rtf:*.xls:*.xlsx;300;false;movies:music:mp3:exe;DESKTOP;%DESKTOP%\;*.txt:*.doc:*.docx:*.rtf:*.xls:*.xlsx;300;false;movies:music:mp3:exe</span><span>
</span></span><br role="presentation"/></p></li><li dir="auto" aria-level="1" class="h4V1a" style="text-align:AUTO;margin-inline-start:1.5em;list-style-type:disc"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="" id="viewer-1c3c1"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>1,1,1,1,0,9fe632d67af2e40151f7e9fafe7a08fb,1,1,1,0,0,Default;%DOCUMENTS%\;*.txt;50;true;movies:music:mp3:exe;</span></span></p></li></ul></div><div type="bulleted_list" data-hook="rcv-block142"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-7t6nt"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block143"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-8nnqq"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>These configurations provide an insight into the evolution of a campaign, in the first example the malware is directed to grab .txt files located in directories containing the string DOCUMENTS with a maximum file size of 50kb. In the second and third example further profiles have been added to grab additional file types in several different directories.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block144"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-42ljn"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block145"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><h3 class="ZSacP XMpE9 WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-6ut9d"><span class="uZXi0"><span>Vidar Payload Updates</span></span></h3></div><div type="heading" data-hook="rcv-block146"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-99o3d"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block147"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-7dl01"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Since the beginning of 2023, three Vidar version updates have been released, mostly recently on 13 January 2023 with the release of version 2.0 (following versions 1.9 and 1.8).</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block148"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-1n3ir"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block149"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-9un2d"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Vidar version 1.8 re-introduced the form-grabbing feature for the Opera Crypto browser, as well as the collection of Opera Crypto wallet data.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block150"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" style="font-style:italic"><span style="font-size:12px"><span>Figure 11: Targeting of Opera Crypto</span></span></em></strong></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block153"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-6buoi"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block154"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-1d1aq"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>These updates were first observed in the wild in use by the </span><a target="_blank" href="https://malpedia.caad.fkie.fraunhofer.de/details/win.stop" rel="noopener" class="hEuCV uw4qb" data-hook="WebLink"><span style="color:#1155cc;text-decoration:inherit"><u style="text-decoration:underline"><span>DJVU</span></u></span></a><span> ransomware operators (within botnet 19).</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block155"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-a5i5j"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block156"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-cl234"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>In the campaign observed by Team Cymru’s S2 Research team, two domains were utilized for the staging of DJVU ransomware (</span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>spaceris[.]com</span></strong><span>) and Vidar (</span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>uaery[.]top</span></strong><span>).</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block157"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-2kupt"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block158"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="tqAje" id="viewer-52eh"><div class="SErax c8QuI" style="width:min(100%, 100%)"><figure role="button" data-hook="imageViewer" tabindex="0" class="Eswhf" aria-haspopup="true"><div style="--dim-height:224;--dim-width:621" id="52eh" class="_2ynrX bqdPo z-4Pg"><wow-image id="6283c5_c317217548a2444dbb0b5f2fa1a2e3f6~mv2.png" class="undefined O4AJH" data-image-info="{&quot;containerId&quot;:&quot;52eh&quot;,&quot;displayMode&quot;:&quot;fill&quot;,&quot;isLQIP&quot;:true,&quot;isSEOBot&quot;:false,&quot;lqipTransition&quot;:&quot;blur&quot;,&quot;imageData&quot;:{&quot;width&quot;:621,&quot;height&quot;:224,&quot;uri&quot;:&quot;6283c5_c317217548a2444dbb0b5f2fa1a2e3f6~mv2.png&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;displayMode&quot;:&quot;fill&quot;}}" data-bg-effect-name="" data-has-ssr-src="true" data-animate-blur=""><img src="https://static.wixstatic.com/media/6283c5_c317217548a2444dbb0b5f2fa1a2e3f6~mv2.png/v1/fill/w_62,h_22,al_c,q_85,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,blur_2,enc_auto/6283c5_c317217548a2444dbb0b5f2fa1a2e3f6~mv2.png" alt="" style="width:100%;height:100%;object-fit:cover;object-position:50% 50%;max-width:100%" data-pin-url="https://www.team-cymru.com/post/darth-vidar-the-dark-side-of-evolving-threat-infrastructure" class="VtuvT" role="button" tabindex="0"><svg viewBox="0 0 19 19" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="leGkP"><path d="M15.071 8.371V4.585l-4.355 4.356a.2.2 0 0 1-.283 0l-.374-.374a.2.2 0 0 1 type="image" data-hook="rcv-block159"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y -XYEb Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-ebnga"><span class="AT4Tn"><strong style="font-weight:700"><em style="font-style:italic"><span style="font-size:12px"><span>Figure 12: DJVU Ransomware Campaign</span></span></em></strong></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block160"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-5aloj"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block161"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-dd7hp"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Since 16 January 2023, the Vidar crew has published a new payload upgrade, which now leads to the 2.1 version. Once again, this was first observed in use during a DJVU campaign, involving the same C2 domains as previously; </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>spaceris[.]com</span></strong><span> and </span><strong style="font-weight:700"><span>uaery[.]top</span></strong><span>.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block162"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-6718d"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block163"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-6cti9"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>In addition to DJVU, we have also observed the most recent versions of Vidar being deployed alongside other payloads, such as </span><a target="_blank" href="https://malpedia.caad.fkie.fraunhofer.de/details/win.icedid" rel="noopener" class="hEuCV uw4qb" data-hook="WebLink"><span style="color:#1155cc;text-decoration:inherit"><u style="text-decoration:underline"><span>IcedID</span></u></span></a><span> and </span><a target="_blank" href="https://malpedia.caad.fkie.fraunhofer.de/details/win.redline_stealer" rel="noopener" class="hEuCV uw4qb" data-hook="WebLink"><span style="color:#1155cc;text-decoration:inherit"><u style="text-decoration:underline"><span>Redline Stealer</span></u></span></a><span>. </span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block164"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-d117f"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block165"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><h3 class="ZSacP XMpE9 WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-8tvhu"><span class="uZXi0"><span>Conclusion</span></span></h3></div><div type="heading" data-hook="rcv-block166"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-56lr2"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block167"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-1ugnb"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Since August 2022, we have observed the Vidar operators updating and expanding their infrastructure, seemingly preparing for a future influx of customers.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block168"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-99a2j"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block169"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-5n03b"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Based on recent updates, including the re-introduction of the form-grabbing functionality for the Opera Crypto browser, and improvements in security with proxies being rotated more frequently, it is apparent that the Vidar operators are listening to their current customers at the same time as seeking new ones.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block170"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-e6mss"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block171"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-ckav6"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>By analyzing the network telemetry data surrounding the Vidar website, we are able to discern how both operators and customers access the Vidar management infrastructure, with some further indications of how other elements of the operation fall into play; for example the traffic to Mega and Telegram infrastructure.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block172"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-ek1oh"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block173"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-1pvj4"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>By examining the </span><em style="font-style:italic"><span>proxy_pass</span></em><span> infrastructure we were also able to ascertain how data may be transferred from C2 servers back to the central management infrastructure.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block174"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-2tu0v"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block175"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-8rjg3"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>Overall, we assess that the Vidar operation is becoming more competent and we would expect to see the rate of update releases and infrastructure adjustments to continue during 2023.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block176"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-95sp0"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block177"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-ditrd"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>We will continue to monitor this threat, to assess any reactions to this publication and to share any subsequent updates or changes in TTPs with the community.</span></span></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block178"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-eustf"><span class="AT4Tn"><br role="presentation"/></span></div></div><div type="empty-line" data-hook="rcv-block179"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><p class="qWK-6 Twp3y WmV-K Lbx1y" style="line-height:1.38" dir="auto" id="viewer-9j0kl"><span class="AT4Tn"><span>For day to day updates on Vidar and other threats, you can follow us on </span><a target="_blank" href="https://twitter.com/teamcymru_S2" rel="noopener" class="hEuCV uw4qb" data-hook="WebLink"><span style="color:#1155cc;text-decoration:inherit"><u style="text-decoration:underline"><span>Twitter</span></u></span></a><span> or </span><a target="_blank" href="https://infosec.exchange/@teamcymru_S2" rel="noopener" class="hEuCV uw4qb" data-hook="WebLink"><span style="color:#1155cc;text-decoration:inherit"><u style="text-decoration:underline"><span>Mastodon</span></u></span></a><span>.</span><span>
</span></span><br role="presentation"/></p></div><div type="paragraph" data-hook="rcv-block180"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><h3 class="ZSacP XMpE9 WmV-K Lbx1y" dir="auto" id="viewer-7vjaa"><span class="uZXi0"><span>IOCs</span></span></h3></div><div type="heading" data-hook="rcv-block181"></div><div data-breakout="normal"><div class="tqAje" id="viewer-5con3"><div class="_8Dh7l _7Nm-V"><div <p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:14px; line-height:1.4em;"><span style="font-family:quicksand;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><a href="https://www.team-cymru.com/ddos-mitigation-utrs-services" target="_self" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:quicksand;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:14px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:#FFFFFF;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="text-decoration:underline;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">UTR</span></span></span><span style="font-size:14px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:#FFFFFF;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="text-decoration:underline;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">S</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></a></span></span></span></span></span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:14px; line-height:1.4em;"><a href="https://www.team-cymru.com/bogon-networks" target="_self" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:17px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:quicksand;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:14px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:#FFFFFF;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="text-decoration:underline;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">BOGON Reference</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></a></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:14px; line-height:1.4em;"><span style="font-family:quicksand;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><a href="https://www.team-cymru.com/csirt-ap" target="_self" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:quicksand;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:14px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:#FFFFFF;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="text-decoration:underline;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">CSIRT As</span></span></span><span style="font-size:14px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:#FFFFFF;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="text-decoration:underline;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">sistance Program</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></a></span></span></span></span></span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:14px; line-height:1.4em;"><span style="font-family:quicksand;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><a href="https://www.team-cymru.com/community-services" target="_self" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:quicksand;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:14px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:#FFFFFF;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="text-decoration:underline;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">M</span></span></span><span style="font-size:14px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:#FFFFFF;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="text-decoration:underline;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">ORE&hellip;</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></a></span></span></span></span></span></p></div><div id="comp-le2x5n5q4" class="HcOXKn c9GqVL QxJLC3 lq2cno comp-le2x5n5q4 wixui-rich-text" data-testid="richTextElement"><p class="font_6 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:16px;
